name: Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the floor.
Step:2 Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing forward.
Step:3 Lift the bar off the rack and position it directly over your chest with arms extended.
Step:4 Lower the barbell slowly to your mid-chest, keeping elbows slightly tucked.
Step:5 Pause briefly, then press the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie on an incline bench (30-45 degrees) with feet flat on the floor.
Step:2 Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Unrack the barbell and position it over your upper chest.
Step:4 Lower the bar slowly to your upper chest, keeping elbows slightly tucked.
Step:5 Press the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Decline Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie on a decline bench, securing your legs at the end.
Step:2 Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Unrack the barbell and position it over your lower chest.
Step:4 Lower the bar slowly to your lower chest, keeping elbows slightly tucked.
Step:5 Press the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, resting on your thighs.
Step:2 Use your thighs to help kick the dumbbells up one at a time, positioning them to the sides of your chest with palms facing forward.
Step:3 Press the dumbbells straight up until your arms are fully extended.
Step:4 Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the sides of your chest.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie on an incline bench (30-45 degrees) with a dumbbell in each hand.
Step:2 Position the dumbbells at shoulder level, palms facing forward.
Step:3 Press the dumbbells straight up and slightly inwards until arms are extended.
Step:4 Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Decline Dumbbell Bench Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie on a decline bench, securing your legs, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Step:2 Position the dumbbells near your lower chest, palms facing forward.
Step:3 Press the dumbbells straight up until arms are extended.
Step:4 Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Push-up
instructions: Step:1 Place hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart on the floor, fingers pointing forward.
Step:2 Extend legs back, balancing on toes, forming a straight line from head to heels.
Step:3 Engage core and lower your chest towards the floor by bending elbows.
Step:4 Keep elbows relatively close to your body (not flared out excessively).
Step:5 Push back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Push-up
instructions: Step:1 Place hands on an elevated surface (bench, step, wall) slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step:2 Extend legs back, forming a straight line from head to heels.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards the elevated surface by bending elbows.
Step:4 Push back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Decline Push-up
instructions: Step:1 Place hands on the floor slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step:2 Place feet on an elevated surface (bench, step).
Step:3 Form a straight line from head to the elevated feet.
Step:4 Lower your chest towards the floor by bending elbows.
Step:5 Push back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Diamond Push-up
instructions: Step:1 Place hands close together on the floor, forming a diamond shape with thumbs and index fingers.
Step:2 Extend legs back, balancing on toes, forming a straight line.
Step:3 Lower your chest towards your hands, keeping elbows tucked close to your body.
Step:4 Push back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Fly
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench holding dumbbells directly above your chest, palms facing each other, elbows slightly bent.
Step:2 Keeping the slight bend in your elbows, lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest.
Step:3 Squeeze your chest muscles to bring the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Dumbbell Fly
instructions: Step:1 Lie on an incline bench holding dumbbells directly above your upper chest, palms facing each other, elbows slightly bent.
Step:2 Lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your upper chest.
Step:3 Squeeze your upper chest muscles to bring the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Cable Crossover
instructions: Step:1 Stand in the center of a cable machine with pulleys set high.
Step:2 Grab the handles with palms facing down or forward.
Step:3 Step forward slightly, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
Step:4 Pull the handles down and across your body in a wide arc until they meet in front of your lower chest or waist.
Step:5 Squeeze your chest muscles at the peak contraction.
Step:6 Slowly return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Low Cable Crossover
instructions: Step:1 Stand in the center of a cable machine with pulleys set low.
Step:2 Grab the handles with palms facing up or forward.
Step:3 Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Step:4 Pull the handles up and across your body in a wide arc until they meet in front of your upper chest.
Step:5 Squeeze your upper chest muscles.
Step:6 Slowly return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chest Dip
instructions: Step:1 Position yourself on parallel dip bars, arms extended, supporting your body weight.
Step:2 Lean your torso forward slightly.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your elbows, allowing them to flare out slightly, until you feel a stretch in your chest.
Step:4 Push back up to the starting position, focusing on using your chest.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Machine Chest Press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad.
Step:2 Adjust the seat so the handles are level with your mid-chest.
Step:3 Grasp the handles with palms facing down or neutral.
Step:4 Press the handles forward until your arms are almost fully extended.
Step:5 Slowly return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Pec Deck Machine (Machine Fly)
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the pec deck machine with your back flat against the pad.
Step:2 Place your forearms or hands against the pads, depending on the machine type.
Step:3 Squeeze the pads together in front of your chest using your pectoral muscles.
Step:4 Hold the contraction briefly.
Step:5 Slowly return to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your chest.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Barbell Back Squat
instructions: Step:1 Position a barbell on a rack just below shoulder height.
Step:2 Step under the bar and rest it across your upper back (traps), not on your neck.
Step:3 Grip the bar firmly, lift it off the rack, and take a step or two back.
Step:4 Stand with feet shoulder-width apart or slightly wider, toes pointing slightly out.
Step:5 Keeping your chest up and back straight, lower your hips back and down as if sitting in a chair.
Step:6 Descend until your thighs are parallel to the floor or slightly below.
Step:7 Drive through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Barbell Front Squat
instructions: Step:1 Position a barbell on a rack at upper chest height.
Step:2 Approach the bar and rest it across the front of your shoulders, using either a clean grip (fingertips under bar, elbows high) or a cross-arm grip.
Step:3 Lift the bar off the rack and step back.
Step:4 Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out.
Step:5 Keeping your torso upright and elbows high, lower your hips straight down.
Step:6 Descend until thighs are parallel or below.
Step:7 Drive through heels to return to the start.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Goblet Squat
instructions: Step:1 Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell vertically against your chest with both hands.
Step:2 Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width, toes pointing slightly out.
Step:3 Keeping your chest up and back straight, lower your hips down and back.
Step:4 Aim to touch your elbows to the inside of your knees at the bottom.
Step:5 Descend as low as comfortable, ideally past parallel.
Step:6 Drive through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out.
Step:2 Extend arms forward for balance or keep hands clasped at chest.
Step:3 Keeping chest up and back straight, lower hips back and down.
Step:4 Descend until thighs are parallel to the floor or lower.
Step:5 Drive through heels to return to the start.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Leg Press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the leg press machine, placing feet shoulder-width apart on the platform.
Step:2 Adjust the seat so your knees form roughly a 90-degree angle.
Step:3 Release the safety catches and push the platform away by extending your knees and hips. Do not lock your knees.
Step:4 Slowly lower the platform by bending your knees until they reach about 90 degrees.
Step:5 Press the platform back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Forward Lunge
instructions: Step:1 Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Hold dumbbells if desired.
Step:2 Step forward with one leg, landing heel first.
Step:3 Lower your hips until both knees are bent at approximately 90 degrees. Ensure front knee stays behind toes and back knee hovers just above the floor.
Step:4 Push off the front foot to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat on the other leg.
Step:6 Alternate legs for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Reverse Lunge
instructions: Step:1 Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Hold dumbbells if desired.
Step:2 Step backward with one leg, landing on the ball of your foot.
Step:3 Lower your hips until both knees are bent at approximately 90 degrees.
Step:4 Push off the back foot and pull with the front leg to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat on the other leg.
Step:6 Alternate legs.

name: Walking Lunge
instructions: Step:1 Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Hold dumbbells if desired.
Step:2 Step forward with one leg and lower into a lunge position (both knees ~90 degrees).
Step:3 Instead of pushing back, push off the back foot and bring it forward to step into the next lunge with the opposite leg.
Step:4 Continue alternating legs, moving forward.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired distance or number of steps.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench or step.
Step:2 Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
Step:3 Keep your torso upright and lower your hips until your front thigh is parallel to the floor.
Step:4 Ensure your front knee stays behind your toes.
Step:5 Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Complete reps for one leg, then switch.

name: Leg Extension
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the leg extension machine with your legs under the padded bar.
Step:2 Adjust the back pad so your knees are at the edge of the seat.
Step:3 Grasp the side handles for stability.
Step:4 Extend your legs fully by contracting your quadriceps.
Step:5 Hold the contraction briefly at the top.
Step:6 Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Step-up
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing a bench or sturdy platform. Hold dumbbells if desired.
Step:2 Place one foot fully onto the bench.
Step:3 Drive through the heel of the front foot to step up onto the bench, bringing the other foot up.
Step:4 Step back down with the trailing leg first, followed by the lead leg.
Step:5 Repeat, either alternating lead legs each rep or completing all reps for one side before switching.

name: Conventional Deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Stand with mid-foot under the barbell, feet hip-width apart.
Step:2 Hinge at the hips and bend knees to grip the bar with hands just outside your legs (mixed or overhand grip).
Step:3 Keep back straight, chest up, shoulders back and down.
Step:4 Initiate the lift by driving through your heels and extending your knees and hips simultaneously.
Step:5 Keep the bar close to your body throughout the lift.
Step:6 Stand tall, pulling shoulders back at the top. Do not hyperextend back.
Step:7 Lower the bar by hinging at the hips first, then bending knees, maintaining control.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
instructions: Step:1 Stand tall holding a barbell or dumbbells in front of your thighs, palms facing body.
Step:2 Keep feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent (soft knees, not locked).
Step:3 Hinge at your hips, pushing your buttocks back while keeping your back straight.
Step:4 Lower the weight towards the floor, keeping it close to your legs.
Step:5 Lower until you feel a strong stretch in your hamstrings, typically below the knees.
Step:6 Return to the starting position by driving hips forward and squeezing glutes.
Step:7 Keep the slight bend in your knees throughout.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Sumo Deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet much wider than shoulder-width, toes pointed out towards the barbell plates.
Step:2 Hinge at hips and bend knees to grip the bar inside your legs (narrower grip than conventional).
Step:3 Keep back straight, chest up, hips low.
Step:4 Drive through heels, extending knees and hips. Push knees out.
Step:5 Keep bar close to body.
Step:6 Stand tall at the top, squeezing glutes.
Step:7 Lower the bar with control.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Lying Leg Curl
instructions: Step:1 Lie face down on a lying leg curl machine, placing the back of your lower legs under the padded lever.
Step:2 Align your knees with the machine's pivot point.
Step:3 Grasp the handles for stability.
Step:4 Curl your legs up towards your glutes by contracting your hamstrings.
Step:5 Hold the contraction briefly at the top.
Step:6 Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Seated Leg Curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a seated leg curl machine, placing your legs over the padded lever and securing the thigh pad.
Step:2 Align your knees with the machine's pivot point.
Step:3 Grasp the handles.
Step:4 Curl the lever down and back towards your glutes by contracting hamstrings.
Step:5 Hold briefly.
Step:6 Slowly return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Good Morning
instructions: Step:1 Stand with a barbell resting on your upper back (like a squat), feet hip-width apart.
Step:2 Keep knees slightly bent (soft).
Step:3 Keeping your back straight, hinge forward at the hips, pushing your glutes back.
Step:4 Lower your torso until it's nearly parallel to the floor, or until you feel a good hamstring stretch.
Step:5 Return to the starting position by driving hips forward.
Step:6 Use light weight, focus on form.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Glute Bridge
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor hip-width apart, arms by your sides.
Step:2 Engage your core and glutes.
Step:3 Lift your hips off the floor until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
Step:4 Squeeze your glutes hard at the top.
Step:5 Slowly lower your hips back down.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Barbell Hip Thrust
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench.
Step:2 Place a padded barbell across your hips.
Step:3 Position feet flat on the floor, knees bent.
Step:4 Drive through your heels to lift your hips towards the ceiling until your body is parallel to the floor from shoulders to knees.
Step:5 Keep your chin tucked slightly.
Step:6 Squeeze glutes hard at the top.
Step:7 Lower hips back down with control.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Cable Pull Through
instructions: Step:1 Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting with a rope attachment.
Step:2 Stand facing away from the machine, straddling the cable.
Step:3 Reach between your legs and grab the rope with both hands.
Step:4 Walk forward a few steps to create tension.
Step:5 Hinge at your hips, pushing glutes back, allowing the rope to travel between your legs (keep back straight).
Step:6 Drive hips forward forcefully, squeezing glutes hard at the top to stand tall.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Glute Kickback (Machine)
instructions: Step:1 Position yourself on the glute kickback machine, typically kneeling or standing, with one foot against the pad.
Step:2 Engage your core.
Step:3 Push the pad straight back by extending your hip and squeezing your glute.
Step:4 Control the movement back to the starting position.
Step:5 Complete reps for one side, then switch.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Standing Calf Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with the balls of your feet on the edge of a step or platform, heels hanging off.
Step:2 Hold onto something for balance if needed. Hold weights for added resistance.
Step:3 Lower your heels as far as comfortably possible to feel a stretch.
Step:4 Push through the balls of your feet to raise your heels as high as possible, contracting your calves.
Step:5 Hold the peak contraction briefly.
Step:6 Slowly lower back down.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Seated Calf Raise
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a seated calf raise machine, placing the balls of your feet on the platform and the pads securely over your lower thighs/knees.
Step:2 Release the safety lever.
Step:3 Lower your heels as far as possible.
Step:4 Push through the balls of your feet to raise your heels as high as possible.
Step:5 Hold the contraction.
Step:6 Slowly lower back down.
Step:7 Repeat.
equipments: barbell/dumbbell (on knees with feet on block)

name: Leg Press Calf Raise
instructions: Step:1 Sit in a leg press machine and place the balls of your feet near the bottom of the platform, heels hanging off.
Step:2 Keep your legs straight but knees unlocked.
Step:3 Push the platform away using only your ankles, raising your heels.
Step:4 Contract your calves at the top.
Step:5 Slowly lower the platform by dropping your heels, feeling a stretch.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Pull-up
instructions: Step:1 Grab a pull-up bar with an overhand grip (palms facing away), slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step:2 Hang from the bar with arms fully extended (dead hang). Engage your core.
Step:3 Pull your body up by driving your elbows down towards your sides.
Step:4 Continue pulling until your chin clears the bar.
Step:5 Lower yourself back down slowly and with control to the dead hang position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Chin-up
instructions: Step:1 Grab a pull-up bar with an underhand grip (palms facing you), about shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Hang from the bar with arms fully extended.
Step:3 Pull your body up, focusing on using your biceps and back.
Step:4 Continue pulling until your chin clears the bar.
Step:5 Lower yourself back down slowly and with control.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Neutral Grip Pull-up
instructions: Step:1 Grab parallel handles on a pull-up bar (palms facing each other).
Step:2 Hang from the handles with arms fully extended.
Step:3 Pull your body up until your chin is level with or above the handles.
Step:4 Lower yourself back down slowly and with control.
Step:5 Repeat.

name: Lat Pulldown (Wide Grip)
instructions: Step:1 Sit at a lat pulldown machine, adjusting the knee pads to secure your legs.
Step:2 Grab the bar with a wide, overhand grip.
Step:3 Lean back slightly, keeping your chest up.
Step:4 Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, driving your elbows down and back.
Step:5 Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom.
Step:6 Slowly return the bar to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Lat Pulldown (Close Grip / Underhand)
instructions: Step:1 Sit at a lat pulldown machine, securing knees.
Step:2 Grab the bar with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart or slightly closer.
Step:3 Lean back slightly, chest up.
Step:4 Pull the bar down towards your lower chest/upper abs, keeping elbows tucked in.
Step:5 Squeeze lats and biceps.
Step:6 Slowly return the bar to the start.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Barbell Bent-Over Row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Hinge at the hips, keeping your back straight, until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
Step:3 Grab the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step:4 Pull the barbell towards your lower chest / upper abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Keep elbows relatively close to the body.
Step:6 Lower the barbell slowly and under control.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Pendlay Row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell on the floor.
Step:2 Hinge at hips and bend knees slightly, keeping back parallel to the floor.
Step:3 Grab the bar with an overhand grip.
Step:4 Explosively pull the barbell towards your lower chest, keeping torso angle fixed.
Step:5 Lower the barbell completely back to the floor (dead stop).
Step:6 Reset and repeat.

name: One-Arm Dumbbell Row
instructions: Step:1 Place one knee and the same-side hand on a flat bench.
Step:2 Keep your back straight and parallel to the floor.
Step:3 Hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand with arm extended towards the floor.
Step:4 Pull the dumbbell up towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body.
Step:5 Squeeze your back muscles at the top.
Step:6 Lower the dumbbell slowly.
Step:7 Complete reps for one side, then switch.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Seated Cable Row
instructions: Step:1 Sit at a seated cable row machine with feet firmly on the platform, knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Grasp the handle (V-bar, straight bar, etc.) with desired grip.
Step:3 Sit upright with your back straight, chest out.
Step:4 Pull the handle towards your lower abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Keep your torso stationary; avoid leaning back excessively.
Step:6 Slowly return the handle to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: T-Bar Row
instructions: Step:1 Straddle a T-bar row machine or a barbell placed in a landmine attachment.
Step:2 Hinge at the hips, back straight, torso angled forward.
Step:3 Grasp the handles with desired grip (neutral, overhand).
Step:4 Pull the weight towards your chest, squeezing shoulder blades.
Step:5 Lower the weight slowly.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Face Pull
instructions: Step:1 Set a cable pulley at face height with a rope attachment.
Step:2 Grasp the rope ends with palms facing down or neutral.
Step:3 Step back to create tension, arms extended.
Step:4 Pull the rope towards your face, aiming the middle of the rope towards your nose/forehead.
Step:5 Simultaneously pull the ends of the rope apart and externally rotate your shoulders (thumbs pointing back).
Step:6 Squeeze your upper back and rear deltoids.
Step:7 Slowly return to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Back Extension (Hyperextension)
instructions: Step:1 Position yourself on a hyperextension bench, adjusting the pad to sit just below your hip bones.
Step:2 Secure your ankles under the pads.
Step:3 Cross arms over chest or place hands behind head.
Step:4 Keeping back straight, lower your upper body towards the floor by bending at the hips.
Step:5 Raise your torso back up until your body forms a straight line. Do not hyperextend.
Step:6 Squeeze glutes and lower back muscles.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Pullover
instructions: Step:1 Lie perpendicular across a bench with only your upper back supported.
Step:2 Feet flat on the floor, hips low.
Step:3 Hold one dumbbell with both hands over your chest, gripping the top end.
Step:4 Keeping a slight bend in elbows, lower the dumbbell back over your head towards the floor.
Step:5 Feel a stretch in your lats and chest.
Step:6 Pull the dumbbell back over your chest using your lats.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Inverted Row (Bodyweight Row)
instructions: Step:1 Set a barbell in a squat rack at waist height or slightly higher, or use a Smith machine or sturdy table edge.
Step:2 Lie underneath the bar, face up.
Step:3 Grab the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step:4 Extend your legs out straight (harder) or bend knees (easier), heels on the floor.
Step:5 Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Step:6 Pull your chest towards the bar, squeezing shoulder blades.
Step:7 Lower yourself back down with control.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Barbell Overhead Press (Military Press)
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell racked at shoulder height.
Step:2 Grip the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step:3 Unrack the bar, resting it on your upper chest/front shoulders, elbows pointing slightly forward.
Step:4 Engage core, keep glutes tight.
Step:5 Press the barbell straight up overhead, fully extending arms.
Step:6 Slightly move head back to clear the bar path, then push head through once bar passes.
Step:7 Lower the bar under control back to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Seated Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor.
Step:2 Hold dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing forward, elbows slightly in front.
Step:3 Press the dumbbells straight up overhead until arms are fully extended.
Step:4 Keep dumbbells slightly apart at the top.
Step:5 Lower the dumbbells slowly back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Arnold Press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench holding dumbbells in front of your shoulders, palms facing your body.
Step:2 Begin pressing the dumbbells overhead.
Step:3 As you press up, rotate your wrists so that your palms face forward at the top of the movement.
Step:4 Reverse the motion as you lower the dumbbells, rotating wrists back so palms face you at the bottom.
Step:5 Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand or sit holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing your body.
Step:2 Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Step:3 Raise the dumbbells out to your sides until your arms are parallel to the floor.
Step:4 Lead with your elbows, keeping hands slightly below elbow height (imagine pouring water).
Step:5 Lower the dumbbells slowly back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Front Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding dumbbells in front of your thighs, palms facing your body or each other.
Step:2 Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Step:3 Raise one dumbbell straight up in front of you until it reaches shoulder height.
Step:4 Keep your torso stationary.
Step:5 Lower the dumbbell slowly.
Step:6 Repeat with the other arm, or raise both simultaneously.
Step:7 Alternate or continue for desired reps.

name: Bent-Over Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells.
Step:2 Hinge at the hips, keeping back straight, until torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
Step:3 Let dumbbells hang towards the floor, palms facing each other, slight bend in elbows.
Step:4 Raise the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc, squeezing shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Focus on using your rear deltoids.
Step:6 Lower the dumbbells slowly.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Barbell Upright Row
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding a barbell with an overhand grip, hands closer than shoulder-width.
Step:2 Let the bar hang in front of your thighs.
Step:3 Pull the barbell straight up towards your chin, leading with your elbows.
Step:4 Keep the bar close to your body.
Step:5 Raise elbows high, bar should reach chest/lower neck level.
Step:6 Lower the bar slowly.
Step:7 Repeat. (Note: Can cause impingement for some; use caution or alternatives like high pulls).

name: Dumbbell Shrug
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding heavy dumbbells at your sides, palms facing body.
Step:2 Keep arms straight.
Step:3 Elevate your shoulders straight up towards your ears as high as possible.
Step:4 Squeeze your trapezius muscles at the top.
Step:5 Lower the dumbbells slowly back down.
Step:6 Do not roll shoulders forward or backward.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Barbell Shrug
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Keep arms straight.
Step:3 Elevate shoulders straight up towards ears.
Step:4 Squeeze traps.
Step:5 Lower slowly.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Cable Lateral Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand sideways next to a low cable pulley, grabbing the handle with the outside hand.
Step:2 Keep a slight bend in elbow.
Step:3 Raise your arm out to the side until parallel to the floor.
Step:4 Lower slowly.
Step:5 Complete reps, then switch sides.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Cable Front Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing away from a low cable pulley, holding the handle (bar or single grip) between your legs or with one hand.
Step:2 Keep arm(s) straight with slight elbow bend.
Step:3 Raise the handle straight up in front of you to shoulder height.
Step:4 Lower slowly.
Step:5 Repeat.

name: Reverse Pec Deck (Rear Delt Fly Machine)
instructions: Step:1 Sit facing the pec deck machine, chest against the pad.
Step:2 Grasp the handles with palms facing each other or down.
Step:3 Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Step:4 Pull the handles back in a wide arc, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Focus on rear deltoids.
Step:6 Slowly return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Barbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand tall holding a barbell with an underhand grip (palms facing up), hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Keep elbows tucked close to your sides.
Step:3 Curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, keeping upper arms stationary.
Step:4 Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
Step:5 Lower the barbell slowly back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand or sit holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing forward (supinated grip).
Step:2 Keep elbows tucked close to your body.
Step:3 Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping upper arms stationary.
Step:4 Squeeze biceps at the top.
Step:5 Lower the dumbbells slowly.
Step:6 Can be performed alternating arms or both simultaneously.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Hammer Curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand or sit holding dumbbells at your sides with palms facing your body (neutral grip).
Step:2 Keep elbows tucked.
Step:3 Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, maintaining the neutral grip.
Step:4 Keep upper arms stationary.
Step:5 Squeeze biceps and brachialis at the top.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Repeat (alternating or simultaneous).

name: Concentration Curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench, lean forward, and brace your upper arm (tricep area) against the inside of your thigh.
Step:2 Hold a dumbbell with arm fully extended.
Step:3 Curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping upper arm stationary.
Step:4 Focus on isolating the bicep.
Step:5 Squeeze at the top.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Complete reps for one arm, then switch.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit back on an incline bench (45-60 degrees) holding dumbbells.
Step:2 Let arms hang straight down, palms facing forward.
Step:3 Keeping upper arms stationary and perpendicular to the floor, curl dumbbells up.
Step:4 Squeeze biceps.
Step:5 Lower slowly, maintaining control and arm position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Preacher Curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit at a preacher curl bench, resting the back of your upper arms firmly against the pad.
Step:2 Hold a barbell (EZ bar often preferred) or dumbbells with an underhand grip.
Step:3 Lower the weight until arms are almost fully extended.
Step:4 Curl the weight up towards your shoulders, keeping upper arms on the pad.
Step:5 Squeeze biceps.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Cable Curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing a low cable pulley with a straight bar, EZ bar, or rope attachment.
Step:2 Grasp the attachment with an underhand or neutral grip.
Step:3 Keep elbows tucked.
Step:4 Curl the attachment up towards shoulders, upper arms stationary.
Step:5 Squeeze biceps.
Step:6 Lower slowly, maintaining tension.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Reverse Barbell Curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding a barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing down), hands shoulder-width.
Step:2 Keep elbows tucked.
Step:3 Curl the bar up towards shoulders, keeping upper arms stationary.
Step:4 Focus on forearm and brachialis engagement.
Step:5 Lower slowly.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Close-Grip Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench, feet flat on floor.
Step:2 Grip the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart or slightly closer.
Step:3 Unrack the bar, position over chest.
Step:4 Lower the bar towards your lower chest, keeping elbows tucked close to your body.
Step:5 Press the bar back up, focusing on triceps extension.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Triceps Dip
instructions: Step:1 Position yourself on parallel dip bars, arms extended.
Step:2 Keep your torso upright (minimal forward lean).
Step:3 Lower your body by bending elbows, keeping them tucked close to your sides.
Step:4 Lower until upper arms are roughly parallel to the floor.
Step:5 Push back up to the starting position, focusing on triceps.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Bench Dip
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench, hands gripping the edge next to your hips, fingers forward.
Step:2 Extend legs out, resting heels on the floor (easier: knees bent, feet flat).
Step:3 Slide hips forward off the bench.
Step:4 Lower your body by bending elbows, keeping them pointing back.
Step:5 Lower until upper arms are about parallel to floor.
Step:6 Push back up using triceps.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Overhead Dumbbell Extension (One Dumbbell)
instructions: Step:1 Sit or stand holding one dumbbell vertically with both hands cupped under the top end.
Step:2 Extend the dumbbell overhead.
Step:3 Keeping upper arms close to your head and stationary, lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending elbows.
Step:4 Feel a stretch in triceps.
Step:5 Extend arms back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Overhead Dumbbell Extension (Two Dumbbells)
instructions: Step:1 Sit or stand holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Step:2 Extend dumbbells overhead, palms facing each other.
Step:3 Keep upper arms close to head and stationary.
Step:4 Lower dumbbells behind head by bending elbows.
Step:5 Extend back to start.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Skullcrusher (Lying Triceps Extension)
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench holding a barbell (straight or EZ bar) or dumbbells with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Extend arms straight up over your chest.
Step:3 Keeping upper arms stationary and perpendicular to the floor, lower the weight towards your forehead by bending elbows.
Step:4 Stop just above forehead (or slightly behind for more stretch).
Step:5 Extend arms back to the starting position using triceps.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Cable Triceps Pushdown (Rope)
instructions: Step:1 Attach a rope handle to a high cable pulley.
Step:2 Grasp the rope ends with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
Step:3 Stand facing the machine, slight bend in knees, lean torso slightly forward.
Step:4 Keep elbows tucked close to your sides.
Step:5 Extend your arms straight down, pulling the rope ends apart at the bottom.
Step:6 Squeeze triceps.
Step:7 Slowly return to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Cable Triceps Pushdown (Straight Bar / V-Bar)
instructions: Step:1 Attach a straight or V-bar to a high cable pulley.
Step:2 Grasp the bar with an overhand grip (palms down).
Step:3 Stand facing machine, slight bend knees, lean slightly forward.
Step:4 Keep elbows tucked.
Step:5 Extend arms straight down.
Step:6 Squeeze triceps.
Step:7 Slowly return to start.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Overhead Cable Triceps Extension
instructions: Step:1 Attach a rope to a low cable pulley.
Step:2 Stand facing away from the machine, grasp rope ends.
Step:3 Step forward, turn around (still facing away), and bring rope overhead, elbows bent.
Step:4 Keep upper arms close to head.
Step:5 Extend arms straight up/forward, separating rope ends.
Step:6 Squeeze triceps.
Step:7 Slowly return to start.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Triceps Kickback
instructions: Step:1 Stand hinged forward at the hips, back straight, torso nearly parallel to floor. Support with one hand on bench or knee.
Step:2 Hold a dumbbell in the other hand, upper arm parallel to floor, elbow bent at 90 degrees.
Step:3 Keeping upper arm stationary, extend your forearm straight back.
Step:4 Squeeze triceps at full extension.
Step:5 Slowly lower back to 90 degrees.
Step:6 Complete reps, switch sides.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Barbell Wrist Curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench, holding a barbell with an underhand grip (palms up).
Step:2 Rest forearms on thighs, wrists hanging over knees.
Step:3 Lower the barbell by letting your wrists extend down.
Step:4 Curl the barbell up by flexing your wrists as high as possible.
Step:5 Squeeze forearms.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Barbell Reverse Wrist Curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench, holding a barbell with an overhand grip (palms down).
Step:2 Rest forearms on thighs, wrists hanging over knees.
Step:3 Lower the barbell by letting wrists flex down.
Step:4 Extend your wrists up as high as possible.
Step:5 Squeeze forearm extensors.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Farmer's Walk
instructions: Step:1 Stand between two heavy dumbbells or farmer's walk handles.
Step:2 Squat down and grip the weights firmly.
Step:3 Stand up straight, keeping core tight, shoulders back.
Step:4 Walk forward for a set distance or time, taking controlled steps.
Step:5 Maintain posture throughout.
Step:6 Carefully lower the weights.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Plank
instructions: Step:1 Start in a push-up position but rest on your forearms instead of hands.
Step:2 Keep elbows directly under shoulders, palms flat or clasped.
Step:3 Extend legs back, balancing on toes.
Step:4 Form a straight line from head to heels. Engage core, glutes, and quads.
Step:5 Do not let hips sag or rise too high.
Step:6 Hold for the desired duration.

name: Side Plank
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your side, legs straight and stacked.
Step:2 Prop yourself up on one forearm, elbow directly under shoulder.
Step:3 Lift your hips off the floor, creating a straight line from head to feet.
Step:4 Engage your obliques and core.
Step:5 Hold for the desired duration.
Step:6 Switch sides and repeat.

name: Crunch
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on floor.
Step:2 Place hands lightly behind head (don't pull on neck) or across chest.
Step:3 Engage your abs to lift your shoulders and upper back off the floor.
Step:4 Keep lower back pressed into the floor.
Step:5 Curl your chest towards your knees.
Step:6 Hold briefly, squeezing abs.
Step:7 Lower slowly.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Reverse Crunch
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your back, knees bent at 90 degrees, shins parallel to floor.
Step:2 Place hands by sides, palms down, or lightly behind head.
Step:3 Engage lower abs to curl your hips off the floor, bringing knees towards your chest.
Step:4 Lift hips slightly, avoid swinging legs.
Step:5 Lower slowly.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Lying Leg Raise
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back, legs straight, arms by sides (palms down) or hands under lower back for support.
Step:2 Keeping legs straight (slight knee bend ok), raise them towards the ceiling until they are perpendicular to the floor.
Step:3 Engage lower abs.
Step:4 Lower legs slowly back towards the floor, stopping just before they touch.
Step:5 Maintain lower back contact with floor if possible.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
instructions: Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with arms extended.
Step:2 Engage core.
Step:3 Keeping legs straight or slightly bent, raise them up as high as possible (aim for parallel to floor or higher).
Step:4 Avoid swinging.
Step:5 Lower legs slowly.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Hanging Knee Raise
instructions: Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar or use a captain's chair (arm supports).
Step:2 Engage core.
Step:3 Raise your knees towards your chest by flexing hips and abs.
Step:4 Avoid swinging.
Step:5 Lower knees slowly.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Russian Twist
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the floor, knees bent, feet flat or slightly elevated.
Step:2 Lean back slightly, keeping back straight, forming a V-shape with torso and thighs.
Step:3 Clasp hands together or hold a weight (dumbbell, plate, medicine ball).
Step:4 Twist your torso from side to side, tapping hands or weight on the floor beside each hip.
Step:5 Keep hips relatively stable, rotate through waist.
Step:6 Repeat for desired reps (each side counts as one or count total taps).

name: Bicycle Crunch
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on back, hands behind head.
Step:2 Bring knees towards chest, lift shoulders off floor.
Step:3 Bring right elbow towards left knee while straightening right leg.
Step:4 Simultaneously switch sides: bring left elbow towards right knee while straightening left leg.
Step:5 Continue alternating in a cycling motion.
Step:6 Keep movement controlled, focus on oblique contraction.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Cable Crunch
instructions: Step:1 Kneel facing a high cable pulley with a rope attachment.
Step:2 Grab the rope ends and pull them down until hands are positioned near your face/head.
Step:3 Keeping hips stationary, crunch forward by flexing your spine and pulling elbows towards knees.
Step:4 Focus on contracting abs.
Step:5 Slowly return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Ab Wheel Rollout
instructions: Step:1 Kneel on the floor holding an ab wheel with both hands.
Step:2 Place the wheel on the floor directly under shoulders.
Step:3 Keeping core tight and back straight, slowly roll the wheel forward, extending your body.
Step:4 Roll out as far as you can maintain control without letting lower back arch.
Step:5 Use abs to pull yourself back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Flutter Kicks
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back, legs straight, hands under lower back or by sides.
Step:2 Lift head and shoulders slightly off floor.
Step:3 Keeping legs straight, lift heels a few inches off floor.
Step:4 Alternately kick legs up and down in a small, controlled motion (like swimming flutter kick).
Step:5 Keep lower back pressed down.
Step:6 Continue for desired duration or reps.

name: Scissor Kicks
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back, legs straight, hands under lower back or by sides.
Step:2 Lift head and shoulders slightly off floor.
Step:3 Keeping legs straight, lift heels a few inches off floor.
Step:4 Alternately cross one leg over the other in a scissoring motion.
Step:5 Keep movement controlled and lower back pressed down.
Step:6 Continue for desired duration or reps.

name: Dead Bug
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your back, arms extended towards ceiling, knees bent at 90 degrees (shins parallel to floor).
Step:2 Engage core, keep lower back pressed into the floor.
Step:3 Slowly lower opposite arm and opposite leg towards the floor simultaneously.
Step:4 Extend arm straight back, leg straight out, stopping just before touching floor.
Step:5 Return slowly to starting position.
Step:6 Repeat with the other arm and leg.
Step:7 Alternate sides.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Bird Dog
instructions: Step:1 Start on all fours (hands under shoulders, knees under hips).
Step:2 Keep back flat, core engaged.
Step:3 Simultaneously extend one arm straight forward and the opposite leg straight back.
Step:4 Keep torso and hips stable; avoid rotation.
Step:5 Reach full extension, forming a straight line from fingertips to heel.
Step:6 Hold briefly.
Step:7 Return slowly to start.
Step:8 Repeat with the other arm and leg.
Step:9 Alternate sides.
Step:10 Repeat.

name: Wood Chop (Cable)
instructions: Step:1 Set a cable pulley high. Stand sideways to the machine.
Step:2 Grab the handle with both hands, arms extended.
Step:3 Keeping arms mostly straight, rotate your torso and pull the handle down and across your body towards your opposite knee.
Step:4 Pivot on your back foot as needed.
Step:5 Control the movement back to the start.
Step:6 Complete reps, switch sides.
Step:7 Can also be done low-to-high.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Medicine Ball Slam
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball.
Step:2 Raise the ball overhead, fully extending your body.
Step:3 Forcefully slam the ball down onto the floor just in front of you, hinging at hips and using core/lats.
Step:4 Catch the ball on the bounce (if using slam ball) or pick it up.
Step:5 Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Swing
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width, kettlebell on floor slightly in front.
Step:2 Hinge at hips, grab kettlebell with both hands (overhand grip).
Step:3 Hike the kettlebell back between your legs, keeping back straight.
Step:4 Drive hips forward forcefully, squeezing glutes, allowing kettlebell to swing up to chest height.
Step:5 Let the kettlebell swing back down between legs, controlling with hip hinge.
Step:6 Do not use arms to lift; power comes from hips.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Burpee
instructions: Step:1 Start standing.
Step:2 Drop into a squat position, place hands on floor.
Step:3 Kick feet back into a push-up position.
Step:4 Perform a push-up (optional).
Step:5 Jump feet back towards hands.
Step:6 Explosively jump up, reaching arms overhead.
Step:7 Land softly.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Jumping Jacks
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet together, arms at sides.
Step:2 Simultaneously jump feet out wide while raising arms overhead.
Step:3 Simultaneously jump feet back together while lowering arms to sides.
Step:4 Repeat in a continuous rhythm.

name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: Step:1 Start in a high plank (push-up) position, hands under shoulders, body straight.
Step:2 Engage core.
Step:3 Bring one knee towards your chest, then quickly switch legs.
Step:4 Continue alternating legs rapidly, as if running in place.
Step:5 Keep hips stable and low.
Step:6 Repeat for desired duration.

name: Box Jump
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing a sturdy box or platform of appropriate height.
Step:2 Feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Lower into a partial squat, swing arms back.
Step:4 Explosively jump up onto the box, swinging arms forward.
Step:5 Land softly on the box with knees bent.
Step:6 Stand up fully on the box.
Step:7 Step down carefully (do not jump down).
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Thruster (Barbell)
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in the front rack position (resting on front shoulders).
Step:2 Lower into a full front squat (hips below knees if possible).
Step:3 Explosively drive up out of the squat.
Step:4 Use the momentum to press the barbell overhead, fully extending arms.
Step:5 Lower the barbell back to the front rack position as you descend into the next squat.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Thruster (Dumbbell)
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other or forward.
Step:2 Lower into a full squat.
Step:3 Explosively drive up.
Step:4 Press dumbbells overhead.
Step:5 Lower dumbbells back to shoulders as you descend.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Clean and Press (Barbell)
instructions: Step:1 Start with barbell on floor, feet hip-width, midfoot under bar.
Step:2 Grip bar overhand, just outside legs.
Step:3 Deadlift the bar explosively, extending hips and knees.
Step:4 As bar passes knees, shrug powerfully and pull bar upwards, keeping it close.
Step:5 Drop under the bar, rotating elbows forward to catch it in the front rack position, landing in a partial squat.
Step:6 Stand up fully.
Step:7 Press the barbell overhead (strict or push press).
Step:8 Lower bar to shoulders, then to floor.
Step:9 Repeat.

name: Battle Ropes (Alternating Waves)
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing the anchor point, feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Hold one end of the rope in each hand, palms facing down or each other.
Step:3 Keep core tight.
Step:4 Rapidly raise one arm up and whip it down, creating a wave in the rope.
Step:5 Immediately do the same with the other arm.
Step:6 Continue alternating arms quickly, creating continuous waves.
Step:7 Maintain posture, breathe steadily.
Step:8 Repeat for desired duration.

name: Bear Crawl
instructions: Step:1 Start on all fours, hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Step:2 Lift knees slightly off the floor, keeping back flat.
Step:3 Move opposite hand and opposite foot forward simultaneously (e.g., right hand, left foot).
Step:4 Take small, controlled steps.
Step:5 Keep hips low and stable.
Step:6 Crawl forward for desired distance or time.
Step:7 Can also crawl backward or laterally.

name: Wall Sit
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your back against a wall.
Step:2 Walk feet forward, sliding your back down the wall until knees are bent at 90 degrees.
Step:3 Ensure thighs are parallel to floor, shins perpendicular.
Step:4 Keep back flat against the wall.
Step:5 Hold the position for desired duration.

name: Resistance Band Bicep Curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand on the middle of a resistance band, feet hip-width apart.
Step:2 Hold the ends of the band with palms facing forward.
Step:3 Keep elbows tucked.
Step:4 Curl hands up towards shoulders.
Step:5 Squeeze biceps.
Step:6 Lower slowly against resistance.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Resistance Band Triceps Extension (Overhead)
instructions: Step:1 Secure one end of a resistance band low (e.g., under foot or to anchor).
Step:2 Hold the other end with both hands and extend arms overhead.
Step:3 Keep upper arms close to head.
Step:4 Lower hands behind head by bending elbows.
Step:5 Extend arms back up against resistance.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Resistance Band Chest Press
instructions: Step:1 Wrap a resistance band around your upper back, holding ends in each hand.
Step:2 Assume a standing staggered stance or seated position.
Step:3 Position hands at chest level, palms down or neutral.
Step:4 Press hands forward, extending arms against resistance.
Step:5 Squeeze chest.
Step:6 Slowly return to start.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Resistance Band Row
instructions: Step:1 Anchor the center of a resistance band to a sturdy object at chest height (or sit with band around feet).
Step:2 Hold the ends of the band with arms extended.
Step:3 Sit or stand tall, chest up.
Step:4 Pull the handles towards your torso, squeezing shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Keep elbows close to body.
Step:6 Slowly return to start.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Resistance Band Squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand on the middle of a resistance band, feet shoulder-width.
Step:2 Loop the ends of the band up over your shoulders, holding them in place.
Step:3 Perform a squat: lower hips back and down, keeping chest up.
Step:4 Descend until thighs are parallel or lower.
Step:5 Drive through heels to stand back up against resistance.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Resistance Band Lateral Walk
instructions: Step:1 Place a resistance band loop around ankles or just above knees.
Step:2 Assume a partial squat position, feet hip-width apart.
Step:3 Step sideways with one foot, maintaining tension on the band.
Step:4 Bring the other foot closer, but keep feet hip-width apart (maintain tension).
Step:5 Take several steps in one direction, then switch.
Step:6 Stay low in the squat throughout.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Resistance Band Good Morning
instructions: Step:1 Stand on the middle of a resistance band.
Step:2 Loop the other end around your neck/upper back.
Step:3 Stand tall, feet hip-width, knees slightly bent.
Step:4 Hinge at the hips, pushing glutes back, keeping back straight.
Step:5 Lower torso towards parallel with floor.
Step:6 Feel stretch in hamstrings.
Step:7 Drive hips forward to return to start against resistance.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Resistance Band Pull Apart
instructions: Step:1 Hold a resistance band with both hands, palms down or up, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend arms straight out in front at shoulder height.
Step:3 Keeping arms straight, pull the band apart by squeezing shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Move hands out laterally.
Step:5 Slowly return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Superman
instructions: Step:1 Lie face down on the floor, arms and legs extended.
Step:2 Simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor.
Step:3 Keep neck in line with spine.
Step:4 Squeeze your lower back and glutes.
Step:5 Hold briefly.
Step:6 Lower slowly back down.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Hip Abduction (Machine)
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the hip abduction machine, placing the outside of your thighs/knees against the pads.
Step:2 Adjust the starting position if possible.
Step:3 Push your legs outward against the pads, contracting outer thigh/glute muscles.
Step:4 Control the movement back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat.

name: Hip Adduction (Machine)
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the hip adduction machine, placing the inside of your thighs/knees against the pads.
Step:2 Adjust starting position.
Step:3 Squeeze your legs inward against the pads, contracting inner thigh muscles.
Step:4 Control the movement back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat.

name: Calf Press On Leg Press Machine
instructions: Step:1 Sit on leg press machine, place balls of feet on lower part of platform, heels off.
Step:2 Extend legs (knees soft, not locked).
Step:3 Release safety catches.
Step:4 Press the platform by extending ankles (plantarflexion).
Step:5 Squeeze calves.
Step:6 Lower heels by flexing ankles (dorsiflexion), feeling stretch.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Triceps Pushdown (Reverse Grip)
instructions: Step:1 Attach a straight bar or EZ bar to a high cable pulley.
Step:2 Grasp the bar with an underhand grip (palms up), hands close.
Step:3 Keep elbows tucked.
Step:4 Extend arms straight down, focusing on triceps.
Step:5 Slowly return to start.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Zottman Curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding dumbbells at sides, palms facing forward (supinated).
Step:2 Curl dumbbells up towards shoulders like a standard bicep curl.
Step:3 At the top, rotate wrists so palms face down (pronated).
Step:4 Lower dumbbells slowly with palms facing down (like a reverse curl).
Step:5 At the bottom, rotate wrists back to palms facing forward.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Plate Front Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding a weight plate with both hands at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions.
Step:2 Let plate hang in front of thighs.
Step:3 Keeping arms mostly straight, raise the plate directly in front of you up to shoulder height.
Step:4 Control the descent.
Step:5 Repeat.

name: Plate Halo
instructions: Step:1 Stand or kneel holding a weight plate in front of your chest.
Step:2 Circle the plate around your head in one direction, keeping it close.
Step:3 Complete one full rotation.
Step:4 Circle the plate back in the opposite direction.
Step:5 Keep core engaged, try to minimize torso movement.
Step:6 Repeat for desired reps.

name: Landmine Press
instructions: Step:1 Place one end of a barbell into a landmine attachment or corner.
Step:2 Load the other end.
Step:3 Stand facing the loaded end, grasp it with one or both hands.
Step:4 Position the bar end near one shoulder.
Step:5 Press the bar up and away from you, extending arm(s).
Step:6 Lower with control.
Step:7 If using one arm, complete reps then switch.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Landmine Row
instructions: Step:1 Place one end of barbell in landmine/corner.
Step:2 Stand straddling the bar, facing away from anchor.
Step:3 Hinge at hips, back straight.
Step:4 Grip the bar end (or use handle) with both hands.
Step:5 Pull the bar end towards your chest, squeezing back.
Step:6 Lower with control.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Goblet Squat
instructions: Step:1 Hold a kettlebell by the horns close to your chest.
Step:2 Stand feet slightly wider than shoulder-width, toes out.
Step:3 Squat down, keeping chest up, elbows track inside knees.
Step:4 Descend as low as possible while maintaining form.
Step:5 Drive through heels to stand up.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Stand with kettlebell between feet.
Step:2 Hinge at hips, bend knees slightly, grip kettlebell handle.
Step:3 Keep back straight, chest up.
Step:4 Drive through heels, extending hips and knees to stand tall.
Step:5 Squeeze glutes at top.
Step:6 Lower kettlebell by reversing motion.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Press
instructions: Step:1 Clean a kettlebell to the rack position (resting on forearm, close to shoulder).
Step:2 Stand tall, core tight.
Step:3 Press the kettlebell straight overhead, rotating palm forward if desired.
Step:4 Keep wrist straight.
Step:5 Lower kettlebell with control back to rack position.
Step:6 Complete reps, switch arms.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Row
instructions: Step:1 Place kettlebell on floor.
Step:2 Assume staggered stance or hinge at hips with hand support.
Step:3 Grip kettlebell.
Step:4 Pull kettlebell towards hip, keeping elbow tucked.
Step:5 Squeeze back.
Step:6 Lower with control.
Step:7 Complete reps, switch arms.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Turkish Get-Up
instructions: Step:1 Lie on back, hold kettlebell in right hand, arm extended up. Right knee bent, foot flat. Left arm and leg out at 45 degrees.
Step:2 Push through right foot, roll onto left elbow.
Step:3 Push up onto left hand.
Step:4 Lift hips off floor.
Step:5 Sweep left leg back, placing left knee under hip.
Step:6 Lift left hand, come to kneeling lunge position.
Step:7 Stand up.
Step:8 Reverse the steps carefully to return to starting position.
Step:9 Complete reps, switch sides.

name: Decline Crunch
instructions: Step:1 Lie on a decline bench, securing legs.
Step:2 Place hands behind head or across chest.
Step:3 Curl your upper body towards your knees, contracting abs.
Step:4 Keep lower back on the bench.
Step:5 Lower slowly.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Stability Ball Pike
instructions: Step:1 Start in a high plank position with shins resting on a stability ball.
Step:2 Keep arms straight, core tight.
Step:3 Engage abs to pull the ball towards your hands by lifting your hips high towards the ceiling.
Step:4 Aim to get hips directly over shoulders, legs straight.
Step:5 Slowly return to plank position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Stability Ball Knee Tuck
instructions: Step:1 Start in high plank position with shins on stability ball.
Step:2 Keep arms straight, core tight.
Step:3 Engage lower abs to pull the ball towards your chest by bending your knees.
Step:4 Keep back flat.
Step:5 Extend legs back to plank position.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Stability Ball Hamstring Curl
instructions: Step:1 Lie on back, heels and lower calves resting on stability ball.
Step:2 Arms by sides, palms down.
Step:3 Lift hips off floor (glute bridge position).
Step:4 Keeping hips high, pull the ball towards your glutes by bending knees.
Step:5 Contract hamstrings.
Step:6 Slowly extend legs back out.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Stability Ball Chest Press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on stability ball holding dumbbells.
Step:2 Walk feet forward until upper back/shoulders rest on ball, body parallel to floor.
Step:3 Position dumbbells at chest level.
Step:4 Press dumbbells up.
Step:5 Lower slowly.
Step:6 Engage core for stability.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Handstand Push-up (Wall Assisted)
instructions: Step:1 Place hands shoulder-width apart near a wall.
Step:2 Kick up into a handstand with heels resting against wall.
Step:3 Engage core.
Step:4 Lower your head towards the floor by bending elbows.
Step:5 Keep elbows somewhat tucked.
Step:6 Press back up to starting handstand position.
Step:7 Repeat. (Scale difficulty by ROM or elevating hands).

name: Pike Push-up
instructions: Step:1 Start in downward dog yoga pose (hands and feet on floor, hips high, forming inverted V).
Step:2 Hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step:3 Lower the top of your head towards the floor by bending elbows.
Step:4 Keep hips high.
Step:5 Press back up.
Step:6 Repeat. (Elevate feet for more difficulty).

name: Muscle Up (Bar or Rings)
instructions: Step:1 Grab bar/rings with false grip (optional but helpful).
Step:2 Initiate with powerful kip or pull.
Step:3 Pull chest towards/over bar/rings.
Step:4 Aggressively transition from pull to dip (rotate wrists/shoulders forward).
Step:5 Push up out of the dip to full lockout.
Step:6 Lower with control, reversing motion.
Step:7 This is an advanced exercise requiring prerequisite strength.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Sissy Squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with feet hip-width apart, hold onto support if needed.
Step:2 Rise onto balls of feet.
Step:3 Simultaneously bend knees forward while leaning torso back.
Step:4 Keep straight line from knees to head.
Step:5 Lower until knees are close to floor or comfortable ROM.
Step:6 Focus on quad stretch/contraction.
Step:7 Return to start.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Glute Ham Raise (GHR)
instructions: Step:1 Position yourself on a GHR machine, knees on pad, feet secured.
Step:2 Start with torso upright.
Step:3 Lower torso forward by extending knees, keeping body straight.
Step:4 Use hamstrings to pull yourself back up.
Step:5 Squeeze glutes at top.
Step:6 Use hands to push off floor lightly if needed.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Dragon Flag
instructions: Step:1 Lie on back on bench, grip edges behind head firmly.
Step:2 Pull knees to chest, lift hips, rolling onto upper back/shoulders (like reverse crunch start).
Step:3 Extend body into straight line from shoulders to toes, angled upwards.
Step:4 Keeping body rigid and straight, slowly lower entire body towards bench.
Step:5 Lower as far as possible while maintaining straight line.
Step:6 Pull back up using core.
Step:7 Advanced exercise.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Single Leg Deadlift (Dumbbell/Kettlebell)
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding a dumbbell/kettlebell in one hand (opposite to standing leg).
Step:2 Shift weight onto one leg, keep it slightly bent.
Step:3 Hinge at the hip, lowering the weight towards the floor while extending the other leg straight back for balance.
Step:4 Keep back straight.
Step:5 Lower until torso is near parallel to floor or feel stretch in hamstring.
Step:6 Return to starting position by driving standing hip forward.
Step:7 Complete reps, switch sides.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Barbell Hip Thrust (Single Leg)
instructions: Step:1 Sit on floor, upper back against bench.
Step:2 Place padded barbell across hips.
Step:3 Bend knees, place one foot flat on floor.
Step:4 Lift the other foot off the floor, knee bent or leg extended.
Step:5 Drive through the heel of the planted foot to lift hips until torso is parallel to floor.
Step:6 Squeeze glute.
Step:7 Lower hips with control.
Step:8 Complete reps, switch legs.
Step:9 Repeat.

name: Seated Arnold Press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on bench with back support.
Step:2 Hold dumbbells in front of shoulders, palms facing you.
Step:3 Press dumbbells up while rotating palms forward.
Step:4 Fully extend arms overhead.
Step:5 Lower dumbbells while rotating palms back towards you.
Step:6 Return to start position.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Rack Pull
instructions: Step:1 Set barbell in a power rack on pins set just below or above knee height.
Step:2 Stand with mid-foot under bar, feet hip-width.
Step:3 Hinge hips, bend knees, grip bar outside legs.
Step:4 Keep back straight, chest up.
Step:5 Drive through heels, extending hips and knees to lift bar.
Step:6 Pull shoulders back at top, squeeze glutes.
Step:7 Lower bar back to pins with control.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Zercher Squat
instructions: Step:1 Set barbell in rack around elbow height.
Step:2 Position bar in the crook of your elbows, clasp hands together.
Step:3 Unrack bar, step back, feet shoulder-width.
Step:4 Keep torso upright, squat down by bending knees and hips.
Step:5 Descend until elbows touch inside of knees or thighs parallel.
Step:6 Drive through heels to stand up.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Side Lunge
instructions: Step:1 Stand tall, feet hip-width apart. Hold weights if desired.
Step:2 Take a large step sideways with one foot.
Step:3 Bend the knee of the stepping leg, pushing hips back, keeping trailing leg straight.
Step:4 Keep chest up, back straight.
Step:5 Lower until thigh of bent leg is near parallel to floor.
Step:6 Push off the bent leg foot to return to start.
Step:7 Repeat on other side or complete reps first.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Cable Wood Chop (Low to High)
instructions: Step:1 Set cable pulley low. Stand sideways.
Step:2 Grab handle with both hands near outside knee.
Step:3 Keeping arms mostly straight, rotate torso and pull handle up and across body towards opposite shoulder.
Step:4 Pivot on feet.
Step:5 Control movement back down.
Step:6 Complete reps, switch sides.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie on floor, knees bent, feet flat.
Step:2 Hold dumbbells with neutral or palms-forward grip.
Step:3 Start with upper arms resting on floor, elbows bent.
Step:4 Press dumbbells straight up, extending arms.
Step:5 Squeeze chest/triceps.
Step:6 Lower dumbbells slowly until upper arms touch floor.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Barbell Floor Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie on floor inside power rack with pins set low, or have spotter help.
Step:2 Knees bent, feet flat.
Step:3 Grip barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step:4 Unrack bar (or receive handoff).
Step:5 Lower bar until upper arms touch floor.
Step:6 Pause briefly.
Step:7 Press bar up explosively.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Wide Grip Push-up
instructions: Step:1 Place hands significantly wider than shoulder-width on floor.
Step:2 Extend legs back, form straight line.
Step:3 Lower chest towards floor, allowing elbows to flare out more than standard push-up.
Step:4 Push back up.
Step:5 Repeat.

name: Decline Sit-up
instructions: Step:1 Lie on decline bench, secure legs.
Step:2 Hands behind head or across chest.
Step:3 Curl torso up towards knees, engaging abs.
Step:4 Avoid pulling on neck.
Step:5 Lower slowly with control.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Standing Cable Row
instructions: Step:1 Set cable pulley at chest height.
Step:2 Stand facing machine, grab handle(s).
Step:3 Step back slightly, arms extended, slight bend in knees, core tight.
Step:4 Pull handle(s) towards torso, squeezing shoulder blades.
Step:5 Keep torso stable.
Step:6 Return slowly.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Incline Dumbbell Row
instructions: Step:1 Set incline bench to 45 degrees.
Step:2 Lie face down on bench, chest supported.
Step:3 Hold dumbbells with neutral or overhand grip, arms hanging straight down.
Step:4 Pull dumbbells up towards chest/armpits, squeezing shoulder blades.
Step:5 Keep elbows relatively tucked.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Reverse Fly (Machine)
instructions: Step:1 Sit facing machine, chest against pad.
Step:2 Grasp handles with neutral or overhand grip.
Step:3 Keep slight bend in elbows.
Step:4 Pull handles back in wide arc, squeezing shoulder blades.
Step:5 Focus on rear delts/upper back.
Step:6 Return slowly.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Scott Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Step:1 Sit or stand holding dumbbells.
Step:2 Raise dumbbells to shoulder height, palms facing forward, elbows pointing down.
Step:3 Lower dumbbells down and slightly forward, keeping elbows pointing down (like lowering on fixed track).
Step:4 Stop when upper arms near parallel to floor.
Step:5 Press back up along same path.
Step:6 Focus on deltoids.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Spider Curl
instructions: Step:1 Set incline bench to 45 degrees or use preacher bench backwards.
Step:2 Lie face down, chest supported, arms hanging straight.
Step:3 Hold dumbbells or EZ bar with underhand grip.
Step:4 Curl weight up towards shoulders, keeping upper arms perpendicular to floor.
Step:5 Squeeze biceps.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: JM Press
instructions: Step:1 Lie on flat bench, hold barbell (narrow grip).
Step:2 Lower bar towards point between chin and upper chest.
Step:3 Allow elbows to flare slightly and move forward during descent (mix between close grip press and skullcrusher).
Step:4 Press bar back up, focusing on triceps.
Step:5 Repeat.

name: Standing One Arm Cable Curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing low cable pulley with single grip handle.
Step:2 Grab handle with underhand grip.
Step:3 Keep elbow tucked.
Step:4 Curl handle towards shoulder.
Step:5 Squeeze bicep.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Complete reps, switch arms.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Standing One Arm Triceps Pushdown
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing high cable pulley with single grip handle.
Step:2 Grab handle with overhand or neutral grip.
Step:3 Keep elbow tucked.
Step:4 Extend arm straight down.
Step:5 Squeeze tricep.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Complete reps, switch arms.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Toe Touches (Lying)
instructions: Step:1 Lie on back, legs extended straight up towards ceiling.
Step:2 Extend arms towards feet.
Step:3 Crunch upper body off floor, reaching hands towards toes.
Step:4 Squeeze upper abs.
Step:5 Lower shoulders back down.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: V-Up
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on back, arms extended overhead, legs straight.
Step:2 Simultaneously lift torso and legs off floor, reaching hands towards feet.
Step:3 Form a V-shape with your body.
Step:4 Keep arms and legs straight.
Step:5 Lower slowly back to start.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Pallof Press
instructions: Step:1 Set cable pulley or band anchor at chest height.
Step:2 Stand sideways to anchor, grab handle/band with both hands.
Step:3 Step away from anchor, feet shoulder-width, athletic stance.
Step:4 Hold handle at center of chest.
Step:5 Press handle straight out in front of you, resisting rotational pull from anchor.
Step:6 Keep core tight, hips and shoulders square.
Step:7 Hold briefly.
Step:8 Slowly return handle to chest.
Step:9 Complete reps, switch sides.
Step:10 Repeat.

name: Heel Taps (Lying)
instructions: Step:1 Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat near glutes.
Step:2 Lift head and shoulders slightly off floor.
Step:3 Reach one hand towards the heel on the same side, crunching oblique.
Step:4 Return to center.
Step:5 Reach other hand towards other heel.
Step:6 Alternate sides.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Seated Overhead Press (Machine)
instructions: Step:1 Sit in shoulder press machine, back flat against pad.
Step:2 Adjust seat so handles are at shoulder height.
Step:3 Grasp handles with chosen grip (usually palms forward).
Step:4 Press handles straight up overhead.
Step:5 Do not lock elbows completely.
Step:6 Lower handles slowly back to start.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Chest Supported Row (Machine or Dumbbell)
instructions: Step:1 Lie face down on incline bench (if using dumbbells) or sit facing pad on chest supported row machine.
Step:2 Grab handles/dumbbells with desired grip.
Step:3 Pull weight towards torso, retracting shoulder blades.
Step:4 Squeeze back muscles.
Step:5 Lower slowly.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Jump Squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower into squat position (thighs parallel or lower).
Step:3 Explosively jump upwards, extending hips, knees, ankles.
Step:4 Land softly back into squat position.
Step:5 Immediately go into next rep or pause briefly.
Step:6 Repeat.

name: Box Squat (Barbell)
instructions: Step:1 Place box or bench behind you inside squat rack.
Step:2 Set up barbell for back squat.
Step:3 Unrack bar, step back so box is behind you.
Step:4 Squat down by pushing hips back, control descent.
Step:5 Sit briefly *onto* the box, maintaining core tension (do not relax fully).
Step:6 Drive up explosively off the box to standing position.
Step:7 Repeat.

name: Single Leg Calf Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand on one leg, ball of foot on edge of step/platform.
Step:2 Hold support for balance.
Step:3 Lower heel as far as possible.
Step:4 Push up onto ball of foot as high as possible.
Step:5 Squeeze calf.
Step:6 Lower slowly.
Step:7 Complete reps, switch legs.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Donkey Calf Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with balls of feet on block/step.
Step:2 Hinge at hips, supporting upper body on bench/support.
Step:3 Have partner sit on lower back, or use donkey calf raise machine pad.
Step:4 Lower heels, feeling stretch.
Step:5 Raise heels by extending ankles.
Step:6 Squeeze calves.
Step:7 Lower slowly.
Step:8 Repeat.

name: Wrist Roller
instructions: Step:1 Stand holding wrist roller handle with both hands, arms extended forward at shoulder height.
Step:2 Weight attached to rope should hang down.
Step:3 Rotate handle using wrists to roll rope (and weight) up.
Step:4 Can roll forward (flexion) or backward (extension).
Step:5 Slowly unroll weight back down with control.
Step:6 Repeat.
